info.title: Organization Units API
info.description:
The Organization Units API enables you to manage B2B functionalities in your VTEX store, focusing on user and unit organization. This API provides endpoints for managing users, organization units, and their associated scopes.

## Index

### Users
- `GET` [Get scopes by user](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/users/-userId-/scopes): Retrieves the scopes assigned to a user.
- `GET` [Get organization unit by user](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/-userId-/unit): Retrieves the organization unit associated with a user.

### Units
- `POST` [Create unit](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1): Creates a new organization unit.
- `GET` [Get unit](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-): Retrieves information about a specific unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete unit](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-): Deletes a specific unit.
- `PATCH` [Rename unit](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#patch-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-): Updates the name of a unit.
- `GET` [Get unit children](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/children): Retrieves the child units of a specific unit.
- `GET` [Get root units](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/root): Retrieves all root-level units.
- `POST` [Move unit](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/move): Moves a unit to a new parent unit.
- `GET` [Search units](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/search): Searches for organization units.
- `GET` [Get all units from scope value](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/scopes/-scopeType-/-value-/units): Retrieves all units associated with a specific scope value.
- `GET` [Get all units from scope value - customField](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/scopes/customFields/-value-/units): Retrieves all units associated with a specific custom field scope value.

### Scopes
- `GET` [Get unit scopes](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes): Retrieves all scopes associated with a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete all scopes](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes): Removes all scopes from a unit.

### Scope contracts
- `POST` [Create scope contracts](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/contracts): Creates contract scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete scope contracts](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/contracts): Removes all contract scopes from a unit.
- `PUT` [Update scope contracts](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#put-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/contracts): Updates contract scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Remove value from scope contracts](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/contracts/-value-): Removes a specific value from contract scopes.

### Scope addresses
- `POST` [Create scope addresses](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/addresses): Creates address scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete scope addresses](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/addresses): Removes all address scopes from a unit.
- `PUT` [Update scope addresses](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#put-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/addresses): Updates address scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Remove value from scope addresses](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/addresses/-value-): Removes a specific value from address scopes.

### Scope payment systems
- `POST` [Create scope payment systems](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/paymentSystems): Creates payment system scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete scope payment systems](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/paymentSystems): Removes all payment system scopes from a unit.
- `PUT` [Update scope payment systems](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#put-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/paymentSystems): Updates payment system scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Remove value from scope payment systems](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/paymentSystems/-value-): Removes a specific value from payment system scopes.

### Scope price tables
- `POST` [Create scope price tables](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/priceTables): Creates price table scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete scope price tables](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/priceTables): Removes all price table scopes from a unit.
- `PUT` [Update scope price tables](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#put-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/priceTables): Updates price table scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Remove value from scope price tables](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/priceTables/-value-): Removes a specific value from price table scopes.

### Scope collections
- `POST` [Create scope collections](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/collections): Creates collection scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete scope collections](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/collections): Removes all collection scopes from a unit.
- `PUT` [Update scope collections](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#put-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/collections): Updates collection scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Remove value from scope collections](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/collections/-value-): Removes a specific value from collection scopes.

### Scope credit cards
- `POST` [Create scope credit cards](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/creditCards): Creates credit card scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete scope credit cards](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/creditCards): Removes all credit card scopes from a unit.
- `PUT` [Update scope credit cards](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#put-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/creditCards): Updates credit card scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Remove value from scope credit cards](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/creditCards/-value-): Removes a specific value from credit card scopes.

### Scope custom fields
- `POST` [Create scope custom fields](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/customFields): Creates custom field scopes for a unit.
- `DELETE` [Delete scope custom fields](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#delete-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/customFields): Removes all custom field scopes from a unit.
- `PUT` [Update scope custom fields](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#put-/api/organization-units/v1/-unitId-/scopes/customFields): Updates custom field scopes for a unit.

### Shopper data
- `GET` [Get shopper schema](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/shopper/schema): Retrieves the shopper document schema.
- `POST` [Create shopper document](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#post-/api/organization-units/v1/shopper/documents): Creates a new shopper document.
- `GET` [Get shopper document](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/shopper/documents/-userId-): Retrieves a shopper document by user ID.
- `GET` [Search shopper document](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/organization-units-api#get-/api/organization-units/v1/shopper/documents/search): Searches for shopper documents.

## Common parameters

| Parameter name | Description | Type |
| - | - | - |
| `accountName` | Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL. | Server variable. |
| `environment` | Environment to use. Used as part of the URL. | Server variable. |
| `VtexIdclientAutCookie` | [User token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-user-tokens), valid for 24 hours. | Authentication header. |

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description: Retrieves the scopes assigned to a specific user.

schema.description: Response object containing the contract IDs representing user scopes.

contractIds.description: List of contract IDs representing user scopes.

get.description: Retrieves the organization unit associated with a specific user.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the unit assignment was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the unit assignment was last updated.

ids.description: Path of unit IDs from root to current unit.

names.description: Path of unit names from root to current unit (can be empty).

customerGroup.description: Customer group associated with this unit.

customerIds.description: List of customer IDs associated with this unit.

post.description:
Creates a new organization unit.

> ⚠️ Deprecation Notice
> The `api/units/v1` prefix is being deprecated in favor of the new `api/organization-units/v1` prefix. Both prefixes will be supported until June 30, 2025, after which the old prefix will be removed on July 1, 2025. Please update your integrations accordingly.

name.description: Name of the new organization unit.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the unit was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the most recent update.

ids.description: Full ID path of the unit.

customerIds.description: List of associated customer IDs (can be empty).

parameters.description: Search query to filter units by name.

ids.description: Full ID path of the unit.

post.description: Moves an organization unit to a new parent unit.

parameters.name: unitId
parameters.description: ID of the unit to move.

parentId.description: ID of the new parent unit.

post.description: Adds a user to a specific organization unit.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Indicates whether user should be forcefully moved to the unit in case they are already assigned to another unit. If set to `true`, users already assigned to the unit will be returned in `addedUserIds`. If set to  `false`, those users will appear in `failedUserIds` instead.

userIds.description: List of user IDs to add to the unit.

items.description: ID of the user to add to the unit.

addedUserIds.description: List of user IDs that were successfully added to the unit.

items.description: ID of the user that was added to the unit.

failedUserIds.description: List of user IDs that were not added to the unit (can be empty).

items.description: ID of the user that was not added to the unit.

delete.description: Removes a user from a specific organization unit.

userIds.description: List of user IDs to remove from the unit.

items.description: ID of the user to remove from the unit.

get.description: Retrieves all users associated with a specific organization unit.

users.description: List of users in the unit.

get.description: Retrieves all scopes associated with a specific organization unit.

scopes.description: List of scope objects assigned to the unit.

scope.description: Type of the scope.

ids.description: List of IDs associated with the scope.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the unit was last updated.

path.description: Path of unit IDs from root to current unit.

ids.description: Path of unit IDs from root to current unit.

customerGroup.description: Customer group associated with this unit.

customerIds.description: List of customer IDs associated with this unit.

ids.description: List of successfully added scope IDs.

post.summary: Create scope custom fields in unit
post.description: Creates custom field scopes for a specific organization unit.

schema.description: Request body containing custom fields and their associated IDs to be added to the scope. Each item in the array is a stringified JSON object mapping field names to objects with an 'ids' array of UUIDs.

ids.description: Custom fields and IDs in a single item of the array to be added to the scope. The string is a JSON-serialized object. The keys are custom field names, and the values are objects with an `ids` array containing UUIDs.

items.description: Stringified JSON object representing custom fields and their IDs.

scope.description: Scope for which IDs were added.

ids.description: List of scope IDs now assigned to the organization unit.

delete.summary: Delete scope custom fields from unit
delete.description: Removes all custom field scopes from a specific organization unit.

ids.description: Path of unit IDs from root to current unit.

customerGroup.description: Customer group associated with this unit.

customerIds.description: List of customer IDs associated with this unit.

put.summary: Update scope custom fields in unit
put.description: Updates custom field scopes for a specific organization unit.

ids.description: Custom fields and IDs in a single item of the array to be added to the scope. The string is a JSON-serialized object. The keys are custom field names, and the values are objects with an `ids` array containing UUIDs.

items.description: Stringified JSON object representing custom fields and their IDs.

scope.description: Scope for which IDs were set.

ids.description: List of scope IDs now assigned to the organization unit.

get.summary: Get all units from scope value
get.description: Retrieves all organization units associated with a specific scope value. You must have the View_Unit or View_Organization_Unit permission.

parameters.name: scopeName
parameters.description: Name of the scope category for which data should be retrieved. Supported values are: `contractIds`, `creditCards`, `installmentOptions`, `collectionIds`, `priceTables`, `paymentSystemIds`, `addresses`.

parameters.name: scopeValue
parameters.description: Unique identifier within the given scope. Example: For contractIds, use the contract ID.

schema.description: List of organization units associated with the given scope value.

id.description: Unique identifier of the organization unit.

get.summary: Get all units from scope value - customField
get.description: Retrieves all organization units associated with a specific custom field scope value. You must have the View_Unit or View_Organization_Unit permission.

parameters.name: scopeValue
parameters.description: Unique identifier for `customField`. Use a stringified JSON object, where keys are field names and values are objects containing an array of IDs.

schema.description: List of organization units associated with the given scope value.

id.description: Unique identifier of the organization unit.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Type of the content being sent.

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
